### Import libraries
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
source.861ee4ef:
## 2016 top ten ramen
tops = sns.catplot(data=top_tens,x='Country',y='Popularity',hue='Year',kind='bar',height=6,aspect=2,ci=None)
(tops.set_axis_labels('COUNTRIES', 'MOST RANKED',weight='bold')
     .set(ylim=(0,10)))
tops.fig.suptitle('MOST RANKED RAMEN BY COUNTRY AND YEAR',weight='bold')
source.ebc6b93c:
plt.figure(figsize=(16,10))
sns.countplot(data=top_tens,x='Country').set_title('Best Countries in Top Ten Ramen List',weight='bold')
source.32139816:
plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
sns.countplot(data=top_tens,x='Style').set_title('Best Styles in Top Ten Ramen List',weight='bold')
source.fef65c47:

data['Country'].value_counts()
source.46a95534:
plt.figure(figsize=(20,16),dpi=200)
ax = sns.countplot(data=data_clean, x='Country',order=data_clean['Country'].value_counts().index)
plt.title('Countries based on Ramen Products',weight='bold',fontsize=16)    
plt.xlabel('Countries',weight='bold')
plt.xticks(rotation=90)

for p in ax.patches:
    ax.annotate(f'\n{p.get_height()}', (p.get_x()+0.2, p.get_height()), ha='center', va='top', color='black', size=10)
plt.show()
source.98576fc5:
## There are lots of brands (147) with 4.5 star and above, so I will display only the first 10 companies with most stars
plt.figure(figsize=(20,10))
ax = sns.countplot(data=successful_brands, x='Brand', hue='Stars', order = successful_brands['Brand'].value_counts().iloc[:10].index)
plt.title('Most Successful Ten Ramen Brands based on Stars',weight='bold',fontsize=16)
plt.xlabel('Brand Name',weight='bold')
plt.ylabel('Count',weight='bold')
plt.xticks(rotation=90)
for p in ax.patches:
    ax.annotate(f'\n{p.get_height()}', (p.get_x()+0.2, p.get_height()), ha='center', va='top', color='black', size=10)
plt.show()
source.32da189a:
## I will use successful_brands df for styling, because I already distrubuted ramens by 4.5 stars and above
successful_brands['Style'].value_counts()
source.e5d9e92e:
plt.figure(figsize=(20,10))
ax = sns.countplot(data=successful_brands, x='Style', hue='Stars', order = successful_brands['Style'].value_counts().index)
plt.title('Most Rated Styles',weight='bold',fontsize=16)
plt.xlabel('Brand Name',weight='bold')
plt.ylabel('Count',weight='bold')
plt.xticks(rotation=90)

plt.show()

source.5b694436:
### SOME QUESTIONS TO ANSWER WITH DATA VISUALIZATION:
- What are the Top ten rated ramens?
- What the country with the highest rating product?
- What country produces the highest amount of ramen products?
- Which brands are the most successful? 
- Which style has the best ratings?
